text: Over the last 24hrs, we've been experiencing issues where any new HubL added to a module isn't rendering at all. This ranges from simply putting in content from a text field `{% module.text_field_name %}` or operators/expression tests `{% if loop. index ==1 %}` - any existing HubL in the modules work find but adding new tags just isn't rendering on the page/preview at all. Are we alone with this?

Hello everyone,
I have a form with "automatic creation ticket" option enabled, which let me add a couple of ticket's properties, namely subject and description, that have each a default value. The form is connected to a channel in the Inboxes section and everything is set as default.
My goal is to have tickets created upon submission of this form reporting the subject and description that I set as default values in the form, but HS instead just generates a default subject on its own ("New ticket created from form submission") and an empty description (see attached images).
Any idea on how to achieve this?
Thanks

I assume it’s a mistake when you typed it here, but just in case:

replace (% %} with double brackets {{ module.text_field_name }} and you have a space in loop.index in your example.

Wondering how to send birthday emails using date picker properties in HubSpot and workflows-I tried between for "your birthday month" if then branching but its not working as it defaults to a year-any ideas on how to do day of send for "is property known and date is "today" or something? thanks

:sparkles: :snowman_without_snow:*Happy Holidays, HubSpot Developers!* :snowman_without_snow: :sparkles: 

As 2022 winds down, we just wanted to take a moment to thank each and every one of you for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community. These have been uncertain times for many of us, but the generosity of knowledge sharing in this Slack puts a smile on so many faces. Thank you all for growing with the HubSpot platform and supporting each other along the way. We’re so excited to roll out even more community programs for y’all to do just that in 2023. Hoping y’all get a chance to rest and enjoy some well deserved time with family and friends this season. Looking forward to working with all of you in 2023! 

All the best from myself and the entire HubSpot team. :orange_heart: :sparkles: :orange_heart:
Hi All, we are new to this environment facing couple of challenges: HubSpot API Accessing error for connecting RoR system

*Error Text*
{
   "status": "error",
   "message": "This app hasn't been granted all required scopes to make this call. Read more about required scopes here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/scopes>.",
kindly let us know how it can be solved?

errors": [
       {
           "message": "One or more of the following scopes are required.",
           "context": {
               "requiredScopes": [
                   "e-commerce",
                   "tickets",
                   "media_bridge.read",
                   "contacts",
                   "<http://crm.objects.custom.read|crm.objects.custom.read>",
                   "crm.objects.custom.write"
               ],
               "requiredGranularScopes": [
                   "crm.objects.contacts.write",
                   "crm.objects.line_items.read",
                   "crm.objects.line_items.write",
                   "crm.objects.quotes.write",
                   "<http://crm.objects.quotes.read|crm.objects.quotes.read>",
                   "<http://crm.objects.contacts.read|crm.objects.contacts.read>",
                   "<http://crm.objects.companies.read|crm.objects.companies.read>",
                   "<http://crm.objects.deals.read|crm.objects.deals.read>",
                   "crm.objects.deals.write",
                   "crm.objects.companies.write"
               ]
           }
       }
   ],
we have selected all the scopes while creating private apps... still we are endup with this issue... can some one can help on this as we have blocked with this almost 10 days

I talked with HS support and I (maybe I should say we) found out that hidden form fields' default values are not sent on submit if this is done via form api.
Here you can support the idea for HS
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Submit-Form-API-take-also-hidden-fields-into-account/idi-p/379005>
